name: Gordon, Secretary of Banking, v. Mitchell, Appellant

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Kephart, Schaffer, Drew, Linn and Barnes, JJ.
parties: Gordon, Secretary of Banking, v. Mitchell, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The opinion filed in this case by President Judge Stern of the court below, who presided at the trial, correctly disposes of all questions involved in the appeal and is hereby adopted by us in affirming the judgment.
Judgment affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Gerald F. Flood, Bernard J. Kelley, Special Deputy Attorneys General, and Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for appellee, were not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Gordon, Secretary of Banking, v. Mitchell, Appellant.
Argued November 29, 1935.
Before Frazer, C. J., Kephart, Schaffer, Drew, Linn and Barnes, JJ.
January 6, 1936:
Graham C. Woodward, for appellant.
Gerald F. Flood, Bernard J. Kelley, Special Deputy Attorneys General, and Charles J. Margiotti, Attorney General, for appellee, were not heard.
